intro: Colubrina micropetala, commonly known as the small-petaled colubrina, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, with five petals that are small in comparison to the flower's overall size. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly hairy texture. Colubrina micropetala is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
